title: Thunderbird 115.13.0 (64 Bit) ... Panel Fonts Are Too Small ...
content:
I am running Thunderbird 115.13.0 (64 Bit) on a Mint 22 OS ... & have spent most of the day yesterday & a couple hours today to find the solution to the SMALL FONT SIZE in the "Folders Panel" in Thunderbird" & have checked several threads of others having the SAME PROBLEM ...

    • I FOUND THE SOLUTION TODAY!!
    • i simply want to save a ton of people the grief that I went through to solve the SMALL FONT SIZE in the various panels in Thunderbird ...

SOLUTION: On the Top Right of the Thunderbird Screen ... CLICK ON THE THREE BARS ... and you will notice that The SIXTH ITEM DOWN IN THE DROP DOWN MENU ... IS "FONT" ... THIS is WHERE you solve your Font Size Problem!! Simply click on the (+) sign to increase the font or click on the (-) sign to decrease the font size!! Viola!! Problem Solved!!

I read where people were directed to the config file under settings and setting up a chrome file ... but you don't need ANY OF THAT ... you DO However need to make sure that in the config file that it is set to the default setting of (-1.0) if it isn't ... & all of us need to apologize to the developers for saying that this updated version of Thunderbird is bad programing ... Because It Isn't!! They gave us a SIMPLE MENU to fix the font size ... we just didn't know WHERE it was!!

Blessings ... I hope this helps a ton of people with the same problem that I had so you DON'T waste a bunch of time and/or stop using Thunderbird because it is the BEST Email Program Out There!!
creator: rod50

title: Edit Single Calendar Event - Send and Close
content: Running Thunderbird v115.14.0. Edit single event. No [Save] button, only [Send and Close]. This doesn't appear for a recurring event, which displays [Save and Close]. Not good.
creator: BPaul_H

title: Thunderbird... receiving full emails on every email received
content: To start, I do receive most of my emails intact. However, there are the occasional email only partially appears. I see enough of it to know who it is from. As an example, I get a bill from xfinity and only what appears to be the graphic part shows up, but, the details of the body of the email do not appear. So I don't know what they want to tell me. All this is in regular Thunderbird. That being said, when I open Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode the full email is then visible. I have tried the reset everything and nothing seems to work. I have taken to only opening Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode as then I am assured of seeing the full emails, text and graphics. Maybe you can help me adjust something to fix this problem. Oh, I am using windows 10 on a pc. Thanks, Dic Bason
creator: dicbason

title: Thunderbird v115 - Snagit Can't Use PrintScreen Hotkey
content:
I use Snagit 2024 to capture the screen, since I'm in the support and documentation business. I just upgraded Thunderbird from v102 to v115.14.0. Now, when I press the PrintScreen key it is suppose to bring up the Snagit capture cross-hair but it doesn't - it always did in TB v102. The worst part is if I click a dropdown menu then press [PrintScreen] the menu always stays open. Because I cannot use the [PrintScreen] key clicking on the capture icon in the Snagit menu closes the dropdown menu so I cannot capture it.

What in the world is Thunderbird doing hijacking the [PrintScreen] key? Or is it? Why doesn't the hotkey work for other applications? Anyone know? Thanks,
creator: BPaul_H

title: forgotten password
content: I've forgotten my password so can't read emails so cannot receive an email answer
creator: romadix

title: Very odd behaviour and cannot reset.
content:
Hello. Thuderbird has been acting strangely for a few days, lots of Not Responding messages and then it sorts itself out. But now, when I open an ordinary e-mail, it opens up in a Send window! With the message which you will find in the attached Image. My version = 128.1.1 esr (64 bit) Lenovo Laptop Windows 10 Grateful for any help folks.

Howard
creator: SmithyHouse

title: Quick Filter Still extremely slow
content:
Quick Filter is still extremely slow on the newest version of Thunderbird (128.1.1esr). I asked a question about this previously. It was reported as a bug (see links below) and it says in the report it was fixed, but the problem still seems to be there in the newest version. Any idea when this will be fixed, or if there is anything I can do about it?

There is a thread about it on reddit. https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/1e6hryp/quick_filter_is_super_slow_in_128/

There was a bug reported, and it is listed as closed (solved). Here is the bug report thread: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1908761

Thanks for you help.
creator: Lynn.Kistler

title: Thunderbird 128.1.1esr quick filter is very very slow
content: Hi to all, after the latest update to 128.1.1esr (64-bit) the quick filter is very very slow and hangs the PC (WIN 11, 16 GB RAM and SSD) for 10-15 seconds. Thunderbird no longer responds and this happens all the time, also with different machines. The version before the update was just fine. Anyone with the same issue? Can you give me some hints/solutions? Thanks, Antonio

title: Lost email subfolders
content:
Hi there, I have installed Fedora on a desktop and CAElinux on a laptop. In the laptop I have Thunderbird and for a while or subfolders were there. On the desktop I decided to try Kmail and all the subfolders disappear which most likely is because i didn't know much about Kmail. Then I tried using Thunderbird on the desktop with the same settings that where working on the laptop and the subfolders dissapear. Then I turned on the laptop while the desktop was on with Thunderbird on, and when i started Thunderbird on the laptop, the subfolders disappeared. Seems like a domino effect. Now all the email are shown in one big list, but only this years emails are shown. If I open the email on the internet through the email provider all the subfolders are still there. Now I have removed Fedora from the desktop and installed an identical setup as the laptop. I don't dare to start Thunderbird on the desktop until i have recovered the subfoders in the laptop and I know that I am following the right path. 

By the way the desktop is dual boot Windows / Linux and if I start Thunderbird under Windows all the subfolders and emails are there.

Could someone please tell me how to recover the subfolders and emails running Thunderbird under Linux , thanks.

TMC
creator: cual1quiera

title: repeterende melding / pop up

Telkens als ik Thunderbird open krijg ik de melding dat er onlangs op de server een item gewijzigd is. Zie bijlage In de aangegeven agenda is het betreffende item verwijderd. Ik kan pas verder werken als de pop up is "verwijderd" . 

Hoe kan ik deze pop up uitschakelen? Zoals gezegd in de betreffende agenda is dit item al  een aantal maanden geleden verwijderd.
creator: loek.gielen

title: Thunderbird 115 keeps re-subscribing to Gmail's "All Mail"
content:
I need help debugging a problem with IMAP folder subscription.

One of my Gmail accounts on Thunderbird 115 keeps re-subscribing to "All Mail". This happens about every second day, and Thunderbird starts re-downloading all messages in the "All Mail" folder until I unsubscribe again.

My two other Gmail accounts for which I unsubscribed to "All Mail" do not have this problem.

I have unsubscribed from the "All Mail" IMAP folder several times (right-click on account > Subscribe ... > uncheck the "All Mail" folder > click OK). I have tried deleting OR not deleting the "All Mail.msf" file (while Thunderbird wasn't running, of course). I have tried refreshing the IMAP folder list (right-click on account > Subscribe ... > click Refresh). I compared the server settings of this account to settings of other accounts which don't automatically resubscribe, and found no difference. I cannot find why this account does this. Unfortunately, it's my most active account.

How can I find what causes this, and fix it?

Thanks,

- Martin
creator: gamin1

title: Adding accounts to Thunderbird's main one
content: After adding inserted the password of a new account to Thunderbird's main one for adding the new account to the app, the procedure stops showing a question with no chance to continue. The question is "Consent app to access data?" and it is followed by a long list of details with no options for going on. How can I overcome the problem?

title: setting up email
content: I just got a new computer running windows 11 pro. I downloaded Thunderbird, which I used on my old computer(windows 11), and followed the steps to set up my email. I know my email address and password are correct as well as the server settings and I keep getting the following error "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password". My email is .verizon.net which is handled by AOL. My husband also uses Thunderbird and verizon email and I checked the configuration against his computer and everything matches. I was able to get my gmail account added so it must be something with aol or windows 11 pro. Any help is appreciated.
creator: christinejohnson2

title: Search messages not working reliably
content:
Hello

Recently my 'search messages' has become increasingly unreliable. This may have been since Nebula auto-installed, but I can't be certain. The problem has happened occasionally in the past, but never regularly.

I usually search all local folders and often now it doesn't find mails I know exist. It will sometimes find them if I then search a likely folder [and its subfolders]. But even when the result appears to be complete it often continues searching till stopped.

Please can you suggest any reasons and fixes?

Global search still seems to work, but it's hard to be sure, and it's far less user-friendly.

Thank you.

Mrs F
creator: MrsF

title: Nieuwe emails komen niet in de emailbox.
content: Tot en met 9 juli 2024 kreeg ik emails binnen. Daarna niet meer. Thunderbird vraagt of ik een nieuw wachtwoord in wil vullen. Dat doe ik maar er gebeurt niets. Willen jullie mij alsjeblieft helpen? De emails komen wel op mijn smartphone binnen.

title: Does deleting profile on one computer remove it from another?
content:
True statement?

Deleting a Thunderbird profile (including "remove message data") on one computer does NOT affect a profile with the same account name on another. Both are IMAP and are not synced to each other.

I need to completely uninstall Tbird and its emails from an old computer without impacting the same profile on a newer computer.

title: Thunderbird internal browser engine failure
content:
I'm running TBird 128.1.1esr, but the problem I'm having occurred even before the last update. I'm trying to authenticate an organizational outlook office365 email account via OAuth2. The internal browser fails to load the organizational page and, instead, presents a box for credentials which fails. Is there any way to stop TBird from using its flawed internal browser engine for authentication? Note that setting the preferred browser for links in emails has no effect on TBird's choice to use its internal browser in this case.

Thanks

title: Thunderbird Email printing (wi-fi connected)
content:
Re Thunderbird 128.1.1 esr. All (i.e. current new emails and all historic emails on file) display correctly on screen. However when sent to print (wi-fi connected printer), significant code block is printed (or shown on-screen prior to printing), and I presume this is (incorrect) encryption of the output data?
